Package dk.via.sep.server.persistence.eventServer

      • dk.via.sep.server.persistence.eventServer.EventDAOManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventDAO
    public class EventDAOManager
extends Connection
implements EventDAO

      void createBus​(Bus bus)

      Modifies the bus of an existing event.

      A method that modifies the event in the database based on the ID of the event, as the method only uses 1 parameter which is an event class.

      This method is for internal use in the DAO, as it searches for the bus using the ID.

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getEventList()

        Specified by:

      • createEvent

        public boolean createEvent​(Event event)
        Method that adds a new event in the database, based on whatever Event class it's receiving. Also this method includes the call of the createBus method, which creates the bus the event comes with.
        Specified by:
        createEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        event - Event class containing the details we need for the database
        Returns:
        boolean that represents if the event was created or not.

      • removeEvent

        public boolean removeEvent​(Event event)
        Method that removes an event from the list in the database.
        Specified by:
        removeEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        event - an Event class that represents the event sent forward to remove
        Returns:
        a boolean that represents if the action was successful or not

      • editEvent

        public boolean editEvent​(Event newEvent)
        A method that modifies the event in the database based on the ID of the event, as the method only uses 1 parameter which is an event class. The event contains the ID of the event that needs to be modified.
        Specified by:
        editEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        newEvent - an event class parameter that contains the new data of the event but the old id
        Returns:
        a boolean the represents if the action was successful or not.

      • editBus

        public void editBus​(Bus newBus)
        Modifies the bus of an existing event. This method is called when the editEvent method is called, as some data for the bus might be modified too.
        Parameters:
        newBus - contains the new data of the bus, except for the ID which is the id of the bus that needs to be search on.

      • createBus

        public void createBus​(Bus bus)
        Creates the bus that comes along with an event in the database, giving it an unique id
        Parameters:
        bus - contains the data of the bus that needs to be added in the database

      • getEvent

        public Event getEvent​(java.lang.String eventName1,
                      java.sql.Date startDate1)
        Gets a specific event from the database that is searched from 2 specific values
        Specified by:
        getEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        eventName1 - contains the name that needs to be searched in the database
        startDate1 - contains the date that needs to be searched in the database
        Returns:
        an Event class that is found in the database with those 2 specific arguments.

      • joinEvent

        public boolean joinEvent​(User user,
                         Event event,
                         boolean joinBus)
        This adds the user to a list that contains users and events. The user is represented by his ID and the event is also represented by the ID. The primary keys are both of the IDs and they are also foreign keys.
        Specified by:
        joinEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        user - this is the user that wants to join the event. It has its unique id stored in this class.
        event - this is the event that a user wants to join. It has its unique id stored in this class.
        joinBus - this represents if the user wanted to join the bus from the event or not.
        Returns:

      • leaveEvent

        public boolean leaveEvent​(User user,
                          Event event)
        This removes the user from the list of people going to events, searching for the IDs of both the userid and the eventid.
        Specified by:
        leaveEvent in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to leave the event.
        event - the event that the user wants to leave.
        Returns:

      • getUserList

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getUserList​(Event event)
        This returns an arraylist of users that are present in the list of events. It will only return users that are signed in a specific event.
        Specified by:
        getUserList in interface EventDAO
        Parameters:
        event - this is the parameter from where you get the ID.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of users that are signed up in the event parameter.

      • getBus

        public Bus getBus​(java.sql.Time departTime1,
                  java.sql.Time arriveTime1,
                  java.lang.String departLocation1,
                  java.lang.String arriveLocation1)
        This method returns a bus that is present in the database with the information given from the 4 parameters.
        Parameters:
        departTime1 - the departing time of the bus
        arriveTime1 - the arriving time of the bus
        departLocation1 - the departing location of the bus
        arriveLocation1 - the arriving location of the bus
        Returns:
        a Bus class that contains the information of the bus from the database

      • getBus

        public Bus getBus​(int id)
        This method is for internal use in the DAO, as it searches for the bus using the ID. ID is unique so there cannot be multiple instances of the same bus with that ID.
        Parameters:
        id - an integer representing the ID of the bus
        Returns:
        the Bus that is found in the database with the given id.
